name: lspprcl

stmt.origin: lspcl(c5, cpr(c1, c2), c4, c0, c3)
stmt.pretty: lspcl(c5, { c1, c2 }, c4, c0, c3)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c5, clmod), wss(cpr(c1, c2), c4)), wcel(cfv(c0, cpr(c1, c2)), c3))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c5))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(clss, c5))

body.pretty:
⊢ ((c5 ∈ LMod ∧ { c1, c2 } ⊆ c4)→(c0 ` { c1, c2 })∈ c3)
⊣ c4 =(Base ` c5)
⊣ c3 =(LSubSp ` c5)
⊣ c0 =(LSpan ` c5)

comment: The span of a pair is a subspace (frequently used special case of ~ lspcl ). (Contributed by NM, 11-Apr-2015.)
